NewsIndiaIndia Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert News Highlights: Heavy rains likely across Himachal, UP, Kerala, Karnataka today, says IMD
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert News Highlights: Heavy rains likely across Himachal, UP, Kerala, Karnataka today, says IMD
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: The southwest monsoon covered the entire country on Sunday, significantly ahead of its normal schedule of July 8.
By: Express Web Desk Updated: July 1, 2025 10:26 IST
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy to extremely heavy rainfall in several states across the country over the coming days. (Express Photo/Gajendra Yadav)

India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) reported heavy rainfall in various regions across the country. From 8:30 AM IST on June 30, 2025, to 5:30 AM IST on July 1, 2025, significant rainfall was recorded in several areas.

Regions affected by incessant rains: In West Madhya Pradesh, Gwalior district received 10 cm of rainfall, with Gwalior city being the hardest hit. In East Uttar Pradesh, Varanasi district recorded 9 cm of rainfall, while Bahraich district received 7 cm. In Assam and Meghalaya, Tezpur in Sonitpur district received 7 cm of rainfall.

IMD predicts extremely heavy rainfall: With the southwest monsoon covering the whole country, heavy rainfall is expected across several states in the next seven days. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy to extremely heavy rainfall over Himachal Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Bihar, East Madhya Pradesh, Odisha and West Uttar Pradesh.

LIVE UPDATES
Sort
Latest
Oldest
15:36 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Building collapses in Shimla due to cloudburst

A five-storey building collapsed in Bhattakufer in the suburbs of Shimla on Monday morning, while several cows from a shed washed away in the cloudburst in Rampur.

The building at Mathu Colony on the road to Chamiyana Super Speciality Hospital caved in, albeit without casualties as the district administration, sensing grave risk, had already evacuated the inmates. However, two adjoining buildings were also endangered.

Reports of rain-induced damages, building collapse, landslides and road blockades flooded the news on Friday as monsoon remained active in Himachal Pradesh. (PTI)

   
15:07 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Thunderstorm accompanied with gusty winds recorded in Himachal Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Telangana

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) released a statement saying, “Thunderstorm accompanied with Squally/Gusty winds with speed 60-90 kmph at isolated places over Himachal Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Telangana; with speed 40-60 kmph at isolated places over Punjab, Haryana Chandigarh & Delhi, West Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Bihar,Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram & Tripura, interior Karnataka, Coastal Andhra Pradesh & Yanam and Rayalaseema.”

   
14:35 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Five-storey building collapses in Shimla, landslides block highways at multiple places

As monsoon remained active in Himachal Pradesh, news of rain-induced damages, building collapse, landslides and road blockades poured in on Monday.

A five-storey building collapsed in Bhattakufer in the suburbs of Shimla on Monday morning, while several cows from a shed washed away in the cloudburst in Rampur.

The building at Mathu Colony on the road to Chamiyana Super Speciality Hospital caved in, albeit without casualties as the district administration, sensing grave risk, had already evacuated the inmates. However, two adjoining buildings were also endangered.

“We vacated the building on Sunday night as the land was sliding after Saturday’s rain. The building collapsed around 8.15 am on Monday morning,” said its owner Ranjana Verma, adding that a four-lane road construction had endangered the structure but no measures were taken to ensure its safety.

– PTI

   
14:20 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Punjab and Haryana receive heavy rainfall

Several parts of Punjab and Haryana, along with Chandigarh, received heavy rainfall on Monday (June 30).

Chandigarh received 70.5 mm of rain in the last 24 hours, according to the local Met department.

In Punjab, incessant rains lashed cities including Ludhiana, Patiala, Pathankot, Bathinda, Mohali, Gurdaspur and Ferozepur.

   
13:42 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Incessant rainfall lashes parts of Chamba

The weather department has issued an alert for heavy rainfall in seven districts of Himachal Pradesh for Monday (June 30). Incessant rains have led to the blockage of the road leading to Chamyana Hospital in Shimla due to a landslide. In Bhattakufer, rocks have fallen on vehicles. Additionally, in the Bathwell area of Sanjauli Ward, a landslide triggered by heavy rainfall caused debris to fall on a house, trapping a mother and daughter inside. The Mayor, local councillor, and the district administration team have reached the spot.

watch | Chamba, Uttarakhand | Rain lashes several parts of Chamba city. pic.twitter.com/1UutcNVrDU
— ANI (@ANI) June 30, 2025


   
13:04 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Rainfall predictions for Northwest India

For Northwest India, IMD predicted isolated heavy rainfall over Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh from June 30-July 5.

In Punjab, Haryana and Chandigarh, isolated heavy rainfall is expected from June 30 to July 3.

   
12:26 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Rainfall predictions for East and Central India

For East and Central India, IMD predicted extremely heavy rainfall (over 20 cm) at isolated places in Jharkhand in the next 24 hours.

Isolated heavy rainfall is also expected over Jharkhand, Odisha, Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, and Chhattisgarh from 30 June to July 5.

   
11:41 (IST) 30 Jun 2025
India Weather Forecast Today, Rain Alert LIVE News Updates: Metro services disrupted in Kolkata amidst heavy rains and waterlogging

Commuters in Kolkata faced significant disruptions to metro services this Monday, the first working day of the week, due to severe waterlogging caused by heavy rainfall. While some services are still operating, they are running at a crawling pace, causing immense inconvenience during peak hours.

Services between Mahatma Gandhi Road station and Park Street have been completely halted. As of the time of this report, multiple metro trains remain stranded at various stations across the network. Metro authorities have issued assurances that the issues will be resolved promptly, but commuters are already feeling the pinch, with many attempting to exit metro stations to find alternative transportation like buses and cabs to reach their workplaces.

The disruption has led to an increase in crowds at several stations, with the escalators at Maidan station reportedly closed due to overwhelming pressure from the throngs of passengers.

This latest disruption follows a similar incident just two days prior. On Saturday afternoon, North-South Metro services (Dakshineshwar to Kabi Subhash) were interrupted for nearly an hour when the drainage channel between the tracks in the tunnel suddenly filled with water. The incident, which occurred between Jatin Das Park and Netaji Bhavan stations from 3:40 pm to 4:35 pm, was attributed to a burst water pipe.

Metro sources explained that the concrete drainage channel situated between the two tracks, specifically between Jatin Das Park and Kalighat stations, became inundated. Officials highlighted the critical risk posed by a flooded drainage channel to the metro’s electrified third rail, which could lead to significant damage and widespread disruption. Consequently, services were immediately suspended on Saturday as per standard metro operating procedures.

Metro workers and officials swiftly responded by disconnecting the power supply to the third line and commencing repair work. The situation was brought under control after approximately an hour of dedicated effort. However, the recurring nature of these disruptions raises concerns for commuters relying on the metro for their daily commute, especially during the monsoon season.

In its Monday evening forecast, the weather department also issued a warning for thunderstorms, lightning, and strong surface winds up to 30 to 40 kmph across all districts of the state, the report added.

article_text: Rajasthan Weather Update: राजस्थान में झमाझम बारिश का दौर चल रहा है. ज्यादातर जिले पानी से लबालब हो चुके हैं. मानसून ने समय से पहले दस्तक देकर पूरे मरुधरा को पानी-पानी कर दिया है. 2025 में मानसून ने रिकॉर्ड रच दिया है. पिछले 25 सालों में केवल चौथी बार ऐसा हुआ है. आगामी एक सप्ताह तक ज्यादातर हिस्सों में भारी से अति भारिश की संभावना है.

Aaj ka Mausam: पहाड़ों से लेकर मैदानों तक मॉनसून का कहर, कई राज्यों में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट; अपने शहर का जान लें अपडेट
देविंदर कुमार Jul 01, 2025, 05:41 AM IST
Ad
   
Today Weather Update: मॉनसून ने अपनी एंट्री के साथ देश में धमाल मचाना शुरू कर दिया है. उत्तर से दक्षिण भारत तक कई राज्यों में भारी बरसात का अलर्ट है. अगर आप भी कहीं बाहर जाने का प्रोग्राम बना रहे हैं तो पहले ये अपडेट जरूर जान लें.
Subscribe to updates

1 July 2025 Weather Update: देश के अधिकतर हिस्सों में मॉनसून की जोरदार बारिश शुरू हो चुकी है. दक्षिण-पश्चिम मॉनसून ने उत्तर और मध्य भारत के कई हिस्सों में अपनी पकड़ मजबूत कर ली है. कम दबाव के क्षेत्रों और चक्रवाती हवाओं के कारण कई राज्यों में मूसलधार बारिश और तेज़ हवाएं देखने को मिल रही हैं. अगले 24 घंटों तक मौसम अस्थिर रहने की संभावना है, ऐसे में प्रशासन और नागरिकों को सतर्क रहने की सलाह दी गई है.




COMMERCIAL BREAK
SCROLL TO CONTINUE READING

यूपी के पश्चिमी जिलों में भारी बारिश का प्रकोप




ज़रूर पढ़ें
मौत की चीत्कार से दहल गई भारत की 'पटाखा राजधानी', ‌जिंदा जल गए लोग, भागने का मौका भी नहीं मिला
अमेरिका से भी शक्तिशाली बंकर बस्टर बम बना रहा भारत, जमीन के अंदर चुटकियों में तबाह होंगे दुश्मन के ठिकाने
हे भगवान ये क्या कर दिया! भारत में सपनों की दुनिया बनाएंगे सोचकर पाकिस्तान से भागा हिंदू जोड़ा, रेगिस्तान में भूख-प्यास से तड़प-तड़प कर मर गया
पाकिस्तान पर गिरेगा एक और 'वाटर बम', क्या है भारत की तुलबुल परियोजना, जिससे तिलमिला उठेगा पाक

प्राइवेट मौसम वेबसाइट स्काईमेट वेदर के मुताबिक, आगरा, अलीगढ़, बदायूं, बरेली, बिजनौर, गौतम बुद्ध नगर (ग्रेटर नोएडा), गाज़ियाबाद, मुज़फ्फरनगर, मेरठ और सहारनपुर सहित कई जिलों में मध्यम से भारी बारिश और 30–40 किमी/घंटा की रफ्तार से तेज़ हवाएं चलने की संभावना है. विशेष रूप से सहारनपुर में बादलों से ढका मौसम बना रहेगा और अगले 24 घंटों तक तेज बारिश और गरज-चमक जारी रह सकती है.




उत्तराखंड में पहाड़ों से मैदानी इलाकों तक बारिश




उत्तराखंड के देहरादून, नैनीताल, अल्मोड़ा, चमोली, रुद्रप्रयाग और ऊधम सिंह नगर में अगले 8–12 घंटों के दौरान मध्यम बारिश और गरज के साथ बौछारें पड़ सकती हैं. पहाड़ी क्षेत्रों में दृश्यता कम होने और सड़कों के फिसलन भरे होने की संभावना है, जिससे यातायात और यात्रा प्रभावित हो सकती है.




छत्तीसगढ़: अल्पकालिक बारिश का अलर्ट




एजेंसी की रिपोर्ट के अनुसार, छत्तीसगढ़ के रायपुर, बिलासपुर, दुर्ग, कोरबा और महासमुंद जैसे जिलों में अगले 3–4 घंटों तक हल्की से मध्यम बारिश और तेज़ हवाओं की संभावना है. मौजूदा मौसम प्रणाली धीरे-धीरे पूर्व की ओर बढ़ सकती है, जिससे आसपास के इलाकों में भी बारिश की गतिविधि फैल सकती है.




हिमाचल प्रदेश: इन क्षेत्रों में बारिश की संभावना




हिमाचल प्रदेश की बात की जाए तो शिमला, कुल्लू, मंडी, चंबा और कांगड़ा में अगले 4–6 घंटों तक व्यापक मध्यम बारिश और गरज के साथ बौछारें पड़ने की संभावना है. लाहौल-स्पीति और किन्नौर जैसे ऊंचाई वाले क्षेत्रों में मौसम अचानक बदल सकता है, जिससे स्थानीय लोगों और पर्यटकों को सतर्क रहने की आवश्यकता है.




पश्चिम बंगाल: दक्षिणी जिलों में बिखरी हुई बारिश




कोलकाता, हावड़ा, हुगली और उत्तर 24 परगना के क्षेत्रों में अगले 4–6 घंटों तक हल्की से मध्यम बारिश और गरज के साथ बौछारें पड़ सकती हैं. कोलकाता में आने-जाने वाले लोगों को ट्रैफिक जाम से बचने के लिए मौसम के अनुसार यात्रा की योजना बनाने की सलाह दी जाती है.




अगले 24 घंटों में कैसा रहेगा मौसम?




अगले 24 घंटे के दौरान, पंजाब, हरियाणा, दिल्ली, हिमाचल प्रदेश, उत्तराखंड, पश्चिम उत्तर प्रदेश, मध्य प्रदेश, छत्तीसगढ़, झारखंड, पूर्वी गुजरात और कोंकण एवं गोवा में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश के साथ कुछ स्थानों पर भारी बारिश संभव है. पश्चिम बंगाल, पूर्वोत्तर भारत, अंडमान और निकोबार द्वीपसमूह, ओडिशा, विदर्भ, पूर्वी राजस्थान, तटीय कर्नाटक, तेलंगाना के कुछ हिस्सों और तटीय आंध्र प्रदेश में हल्की से मध्यम बारिश हो सकती है. आंतरिक कर्नाटक, रायलसीमा, केरल, तमिलनाडु, लक्षद्वीप और जम्मू-कश्मीर में हल्की बारिश की संभावना है.




(साभार स्काईमेट वेदर)

कहानी अभी बाक़ी है…

Rains hamper rescue operations
The Hans India
Hans News Service | 1 July 2025 10:17 AM IST
HIGHLIGHTS
Hyderabad: Heavy rain disrupts the rescue operations at the site of the massive explosion that occurred at the Sigachi Industries Pvt Ltd., located in...

Hyderabad: Heavy rain disrupts the rescue operations at the site of the massive explosion that occurred at the Sigachi Industries Pvt Ltd., located in Sangareddy district on Monday. A devastating explosion at a chemical unit claimed 15 lives and left over several workers injured.

The operations have been going on at the destruction site in Pashamylaram industrial area to rescue the trapped person working at the chemical factory during the blast. With the heavy rains, the rescue operations were disrupted. The officials said with the heavy rains, the teams faced difficulties to remove the rubble to find the trapped workers. “The rescue operations will be continued after all the trapped persons are identified.”

By the night, officials finally released a list stating that 149 employees were on duty at the time of the explosion. Of them, 12 had died and 34 were injured and shifted to various hospitals. However, officials were still unsure how many remained trapped under the rubble.

Meanwhile, Health Minister Damodar Rajanarasimha instructed health officials to send a team of forensics to the Patancheru area hospital for the assistance for the DNA testing. Also, ten ambulances were pressed into service for the transportation of the dead bodies.

The operation was going on since the morning to rescue the trapped persons, as the intensity of the blast led to the collapse of the three-storey manufacturing unit and engulfing various sections of the factory.
